work.name: Global Engineering & Materials, Inc.
work.summary: Lead the development and deployment of novel machine learning models to accelerate the prediction of multi-physics simulations, such as using neural operators and variational autoencoders to learn aircraft aerodynamics, process modeling of composite curing, and applying large language models (LLM) to discover optimal polymer/composite structures for defense applications. Another line of work is on building digital twins for additive manufacturing.
highlights: Write small-business research proposals (e.g., SBIR/STTR) and develop teaming strategies with academic collaborators;
Develop and implement novel numerical methods for computational mechanics modeling;
Supervise team members and lead quarterly reviews with technical team and sponsors;
Publish high-quality papers on top-tier journals/conferences.
